wikipedia_page.main: Jeanie Gwynne Bettany Kernahan (25 January 1857 – 16 February 1941) was a British novelist, sometimes publishing under the name Mrs. Coulson Kernahan after her second marriage in 1892.

response: On 15 June 1892, at the age of 32, he married Jeanie Gwynne Bettany at St John the Evangelist, East Dulwich, Southwark, England.London Metropolitan Archives; London, England; Reference Number: p73/jne/018. Ancestry.com. London, England, Church of England Marriages and Banns, 1754–1932 [database on-line]. Provo, UT, USA: Ancestry.com Operations, Inc., 2010. Church of England Parish Registers. London Metropolitan Archives, London. An author herself, Jeanie most notably wrote the Bed Time Stories series, collaborating with her husband and Dorothy Furniss as illustrator. She had already had a child named George K. Bettany who was born in 1892 and who became Coulson’s step-son.Ancestry.com. 1901 England Census [database on-line]. Provo, UT, USA: Ancestry.com Operations Inc, 2005. Census Returns of England and Wales, 1901. Kew, Surrey, England: The National Archives, 1901. Data imaged from the National Archives, London, England.
